pages.text: The $(item)Redstone Transmitter$() is able to transfer redstone signals to another Redstone Transmitter over up to 40 Blocks.$(br)In order to transmit a signal, the two blocks must be bound. The block that stores the position can convey the signal, the other one will always passively react.
This also means that in a chain, only the last block cannot be activated by, let's say, a lever. All blocks that are linked to the next block can, and will activate all following blocks.

In these images, the block with the glass on the top is bound to the position of the block with the glass on the left. The blocks with the glass on top (the blocks which are bound to a position) cannot emit a redstone signal; however, they can receive one.
